definitions.definition: Two or more people including or consisting of the speaker(s)/writer(s).

subdefinitions.definition: Excluding the person(s) being addressed. ( This is the exclusive we . )
examples: We are here to arrest you.

subdefinitions.definition: Including the person(s) being addressed. ( This is the inclusive we . )
examples: We need to have a talk, you and me.

definitions.definition: The institution which the speaker/writer is acting for. ( This is the editorial we , used by writers and others when speaking with the authority of their publication or organisation. )
examples: We will in due course state our reasons for publishing the name of the accused.
As the government, we have a duty to ensure public safety.

definitions.definition: Any other entity that the speaker is a part of or identifies with, such as place of employment or education, nation , region , language , etc.
examples: I went to watch our school football match against Puddletown High. We lost 2-0.
In English, we do not inflect adjectives for gender.
We still have much to learn about quantum mechanics.

definitions.definition: ( royal ) The sovereign alone in his or her capacity as monarch . ( This is the royal we . The reflexive case of this sense of we is ourself . )
examples: We are Queen of all these Isles.
Good evening everyone. How are we all tonight?

definitions.definition: ( colloquial ; may sometimes seem patronising ) An individual being addressed; used especially to a person in the speaker's care, or to whom advice or instruction is being given. ( Sometimes called the nurse's we or the doctor's we . )
examples: Hello Mrs Miggins. How are we feeling this morning?
You've been spending all your money boozing when you have a wife and family to support. I think we need to get our priorities straight.

definitions.definition: ( colloquial , uncommon ) Used to refer to a third person, especially someone in the speaker's care.
examples: "I've just been to see Mrs Miggins." — "And how is she?" — "I'm afraid we aren't too good today."

definitions.definition: Used to connect to or include readers or listeners.

subdefinitions.definition: ( colloquial ) Used to imply connection between the speaker's experiences or activities and a group of listeners . ( Compare the plural of modesty . )
examples: Hey guys, in this video I'll show you how I make my upside-down sponge cake. First we take 200 g of butter and we whisk in 200 g of sugar. Next, we ...

subdefinitions.definition: Used in explanatory or procedural writing, such as mathematical explanations, to imply inclusion of the reader in the undertaking.
examples: To solve the equation, we first collect all the terms in x on one side.

definitions.definition: ( colloquial ) Used when talking to oneself to refer to oneself.
examples: Now then ... let me see ... I hope I'm doing this right ... if we just connect these two wires together ...

definitions.definition: ( bridge ) The side which is keeping score .

main_definition: Two or more people including or consisting of the speaker(s)/writer(s).
secondary_definitions: The institution which the speaker/writer is acting for. ( This is the editorial we , used by writers and others when speaking with the authority of their publication or organisation. )
Any other entity that the speaker is a part of or identifies with, such as place of employment or education, nation , region , language , etc.
( royal ) The sovereign alone in his or her capacity as monarch . ( This is the royal we . The reflexive case of this sense of we is ourself . )

( colloquial ; may sometimes seem patronising ) An individual being addressed; used especially to a person in the speaker's care, or to whom advice or instruction is being given. ( Sometimes called the nurse's we or the doctor's we . )
( colloquial , uncommon ) Used to refer to a third person, especially someone in the speaker's care.
Used to connect to or include readers or listeners.
( colloquial ) Used when talking to oneself to refer to oneself.
( bridge ) The side which is keeping score .

examples: He was a propa gadgie, and always bought we drinks after a long shift.
And what have you done for we since? Nowt!
